relationships.description: Both proposing tax reform plans after 2016 election
U.S. Trust operates through Bank of America, N.A.

analysis.purpose: To inform clients about anticipated tax law changes following the 2016 election and provide preliminary planning guidance
analysis.significance: Early analysis of potential major tax reforms under the incoming Trump administration and Republican-controlled Congress

concerns: Proposed IRS regulations on valuation discounts for family-controlled entities may not proceed due to election results

notable_quotes: The election of Donald Trump as President is expected to lead to significant tax law changes.
It is likely that the Affordable Care Act, and its taxes, could be repealed in early 2017 and result in an immediate tax cut for dividends, capital gains and high-income earners.
If federal estate tax repeal is only temporary, it will presumably be necessary to include alternate dispositive provisions, in case the tax is reinstated.
red_flags: Uncertainty about temporary nature of estate tax repeal could create planning complications

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion present in this tax advisory document

illegal_activity.description: Document contains legitimate tax planning advice with no illegal activity

public_knowledge.context: Tax policy changes following presidential elections are typically widely covered by media

analysis.summary: This tax alert from U.S. Trust analyzes anticipated tax law changes following Donald Trump's 2016 election victory, including potential repeal of the Affordable Care Act taxes and comprehensive tax reform, while providing clients with preliminary planning strategies for income tax, estate tax, and gift tax considerations under the proposed Republican plans.
